discussion.content:
C : 

The retention period for manual backups is the same as automatic backups which is 60 days.

From <https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/user/backup-manual.html#GUID-3C1B814B-1552-45C7-8856-4AC623E0AD6D>

questions.question_text: What is the default retention period for both Automatic and Manual Autonomous Database Backups?

choices.D: Oracle automatically applies security updates to ensure data is not vulnerable to known attack vectors.
choices.B: Network connections from clients to Autonomous Database are encrypted using the client credentials wallet.
choices.C: Users are given OS logons or SYSDBA privileges to prevent phishing attacking.
choices.A: Data is encrypted at rest using transparent data encryption.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true regarding how Autonomous Database provides data security? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I agree with B.

B. Mask your sensitive data.

questions.question_text: Which task is NOT automatically performed by the Oracle Autonomous Database?
When exporting a notebook, what type of file is created?

choices.C: Creating and scaling of Autonomous Database service.
choices.D: Wizard to download connection wallet for connection from desktop tools.
choices.A: Autonomous Databases monitoring for usage and query performance.

discussion.content:
Ans: AD

Each Autonomous Database instance has its own service console for monitoring that specific instance. The Overview and Activity tabs in the Service Console provide information about the performance of the service. The Activity tab also shows past and current monitored SQL statements and detailed information about each statement. Also from the Service Console for your Autonomous Database you can download Client Credentials (Wallet) , pick Administration, then Download the Client Credentials (Wallet).
Definitely not C as it says create and scale ADB
It is C and D because the answer A says that it uses the console to act on the querys and the usage of these. But we don't need to do this in ADB
A and D are correct. I have checked by login in to service console. Scaling is not an option via service console but downloading a wallet for connections is.

comments.content: You are right, you can scale up/down from the OCI console, but not from the service console. So it must be true A and D. And you can't create a ADB from service console. Service console can be used once ADB is created.

discussion.content: A and D are the correct options.

Original is correct AC
Docs.oracle.com. Cloud/ cloud platform / autonomous data warehouse
Auto scaling is enabled by default when you create an Autonomous Database instance or you can use Scale Up/Down on the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure console to enable or disable auto scaling.

D. Is selected from autonomous database details page under dB connection then wallet
